page.title: 10A FARM IN WITTON GILBERT
page.content: The farmer comes from a farming family(his father,grandfather and back for many generations).He moved to Fulforth 3 years ago and now works both Fulforth and Witton farms.He is a tennant farmer.He remarked that if a tennancy is given up (or lapses) it is offered to an adjoining farmer;thus, in effect merging farms.Together the two farms cover 400 acres which he regards as a typical size for farms in the area.The labour force is 3 men (the farmer his 18 yr. old son and one paid man) but the farmer's wife also helps with some jobs(looking after sick lambs and such like). Since they have moved to Fulforth they have taken down a lot of small out buildings and put up one large shed.In winter it is littered for the cattle(Nov-Mar).Then it is cleared out and used as a shearing shed.
